text: The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone. By the LORD has this been done; it is wonderful in our eyes. This is the day the LORD has made; let us rejoice in it and be glad. LORD, grant salvation! LORD, grant good fortune! Psalms 118: 22-25

From @MerriamWebster 
Fiction: 1.(a) something invented by the imagination or feigned; specifically: an invented story #Sayfie  https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/with-senate-seat-at-stake-tensions-between-scott-rubio-strain-relations-in-gop/2018/04/05/f893fed6-382b-11e8-acd5-35eac230e514_story.html

Great read about #Elkhart #Indiana where high-school stu­dents skip col­lege for fac­tory jobs that of­fer great pay & ben­e­fits, for-hire signs “sprout like road­side weeds” & “work­ers are so flush that car deal­ers can’t keep new pick­ups on the lot”  https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-future-of-americas-economy-looks-a-lot-like-elkhart-indiana-1522942393

Jobs of the 21st century all require advanced skills. We need more machinists & welders & we need more engineers & scientists. https://www.usnews.com/news/stem-solutions/articles/2018-04-05/business-leaders-educators-work-to-bridge-stem-skills-gap-in-northeast-florida?src=usn_tw

Nearly 200 days after Hurricane Maria, in the richest country in the history of the world, some Puerto Ricans still don't have power – but billionaires got tax cuts. https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/in-puerto-ricos-last-mile-power-is-still-elusive-as-next-hurricane-season-looms/2018/04/04/00dc0cb4-1e69-11e8-b2d9-08e748f892c0_story.html?utm_term=.598188b57d97&wpisrc=nl_rainbow&wpmm=1

Yesterday, I met with Stephon Clark's grandmother in Sacramento. My heart breaks over what happened to her grandson. In the face of deep, personal grief, his family members, friends & this whole community have been courageous leaders & kept this issue in the national spotlight. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DaHSkg4XcAArgyr.jpg

Thanks to the folks at @SmrtGrls we'll be live-streaming from my town hall in Long Beach later today. Tune in starting at 1:30 PM PT/4:30 PM ET. https://www.facebook.com/SenatorKamalaHarris/

RT @transportworker The TWU is fighting to keep jet mechanic jobs on US soil.  The airline industry is extremely profitable and this betrayal of America’s working families must stop.

https://www.forbes.com/sites/tedreed/2018/04/06/amount-of-outsourced-offshore-airline-maintenance-work-has-risen-report-says/#4c91037b26e2

I stand with Vermont state employees and retirees. Workers across the country are being squeezed by flat wages and rising health care costs. Our public sector workers must have access to fair wages, health care, needed medicines and a secure retirement. https://www.sevendaysvt.com/OffMessage/archives/2018/04/04/union-slams-scott-administration-over-prescription-drug-changes
The federal minimum wage is $7.25/hr. Do the math. That’s less than $15,000 a year — not nearly enough to keep a roof over your head.

RT @marcorubio Good news for #Florida Agriculture,especially citrus. As he told me he would when we spoke Monday @SecretarySonny has announced process for disbursing the aid we approved in disaster relief bill. Money will be available no later than July 16 #Sayfie  https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDAOC/bulletins/1e7adae

Hi everyone, Kamala's team here. We'll be live-tweeting from her town hall today in Long Beach. You can also watch a live stream of the town hall on her Facebook page. It starts in just a few minutes: https://www.facebook.com/SenatorKamalaHarris/videos/662623154080821/

RT @BHCHP "You are the ones on the front lines. You are the ones doing the work, and it's our job to support you, and give you what you need to end this epidemic." -@SenWarren to BHCHP staff and others working on the opioid crisis

RT @marty_walsh @SenWarren is a strong leader because she understands the important role local professionals play in decision making. The #CAREAct is a bill that gives local voices a chance to shape how investments of federal resources are used in recovery services in our communities.

Great visit to @LockheedMartin in #Orlando today. I toured the facilities and learned how they’re improving the systems our armed forces use to keep us safe. #Sayfie http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DaIIHucX0AA5aTE.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DaIIIm1XkAEq-rX.jpg

I love Midland/Odessa. If the whole country could adopt West Texas values, it would turn the country around. http://www.kxxv.com/story/37882552/senator-ted-cruz-talks-upcoming-election-local-economy-2nd-amendment-during-basin-visit #ToughAsTexas #CruzCrew #KeepTexasRed #TXSen
There are whole industries being built up around people incarcerating and detaining black, brown, and poor people. We need to address that. #LBTownHall
There is a direct connection between public education and public safety. #LBTownHall
Dreamers are Americans in every way but on paper. Congress must do right by them. Let’s give them a path to citizenship.

RT @smrtgrls “I don’t believe we are divided. I believe, based on all of my personal and professional experience, that the vast majority of us have so much more in common than what separates us.” - @SenKamalaHarris #LBTownHall http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DaIPU5PU0AEy0ZF.jpg
This fight is not about fighting against something. It's about fighting for something - fighting for the ideals of this country. #LBTownHall
Today @FEMA announced more than $8.7 million in reimbursement funds to St. John’s County for debris removal efforts as a result of #HurricaneMatthew. #sayfie

It’s so exciting and motivating to see a record number of women running for office in 2018. Bring on November! ♀ https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/women-running-for-house-record_us_5ac6c143e4b09d0a1191cd26

RT @smrtgrls .@SenKamalaHarris on Dreamers who come to her DC office: "They truly believe that if they walk those halls and they are seen and their stories are heard, they believe it will matter. They believe in our democracy, and we've got to keep it up." #protectdreamers #dreamactnow

I spoke with Sequita Thompson, the grandmother of Stephon Clark, at my town hall yesterday. I think about the work of his family, friends, and community in the face of deep personal grief. My heart breaks for what’s happened. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DaIyK2-V4AA1J4n.jpg

Senator Daniel Akaka leaves a remarkable legacy. A veteran and the first US senator of Native Hawaiian descent, he was a passionate champion for veterans, for Native Hawaiians, for tribal self-determination, and for justice. My condolences to his family. http://www.staradvertiser.com/2018/04/06/breaking-news/former-sen-daniel-akaka-dies-at-age-93/
Regardless of what President Trump says: Russia interfered in our elections. There's literally no doubt. It's not a debatable point.

One teacher in Oklahoma reported having only 29 textbooks for 87 students. That's outrageous. I stand in solidarity with Oklahoma teachers who are fighting for the resources they need to do their jobs.
